message.content:
A Hendiadys is a figure of speech in which two separate words are combined to form a single, new word with a unique meaning. The term "Hendiadys" comes from Greek and literally means "two into one."
In a Hendiadys construction, two nouns or other parts of speech that are typically used separately are combined in a way that creates an idea that is stronger or more vivid than either individual word could convey alone. The resulting phrase often has a poetic or literary quality to it.
Some examples of Hendiadiys include:

  * "Make love" (sex)
  * "Break the ice" (begin a conversation)
  * "To get into bed" (to have sex)

Hendiadiys are often considered a type of synesthesia, in which two senses or concepts are combined to create a new and unique experience.
